method_of_cooking:
1. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions until golden brown.
3. Add the ginger and garlic paste and sauté for another minute.
4. Add the chicken and cook until it turns white.
5. Add salt and 2 cups of water and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
6. In a separate pot, boil water and add the soaked rice. Cook until it is 90% done.
7. Layer the cooked rice on top of the chicken in the pot. Drizzle saffron water and ghee on top.
8. Cover the pot and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes.
9. Serve hot with raita or salad.

ingredients: 1 lb beef, cut into small pieces
method_of_cooking: 1. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions until golden brown. 2. Add the ginger and garlic paste and sauté for another minute. 3. Add the beef and cook on high heat until the meat is browned. 4. Reduce heat to low and add red chilli powder, salt and enough water to cover the beef. 5. Cover the pan and simmer until the beef is tender and the water has evaporated. 6. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. 7. Serve hot with steamed rice or naan bread.

1. Peel and devein the prawns, wash and keep aside.
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions until golden brown.
3. Add the ginger and garlic paste and sauté for another minute.
4. Add the prawns and sauté until they are cooked.
5. Add the coconut milk and let it simmer for 5-7 minutes until the sauce thickens.
6. Add salt to taste and garnish with chopped cilantro leaves.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Marinate the Hilsa fish with turmeric powder and salt, keep aside.
2. Soak mustard seeds in water for 30 minutes.
3. Grind the mustard seeds with green chilies to make a smooth paste.
4. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions until golden brown.
5. Add the mustard paste and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
6. Add water and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
7. Add the marinated Hilsa fish and let it cook for 10-12 minutes.
8. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Wash the rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions until golden brown.
3. Add the ginger and garlic paste and sauté for another minute.
4. Add the beef and sauté until it is cooked.
5. Add water and let it simmer for 30 minutes until the beef is tender.
6. Drain the water from the soaked rice.
7. Add the rice to the beef and mix well.
8. Add water and cook until the rice is done.
9. Garnish with fried onions and chopped cilantro leaves.
10. Serve hot with raita and salad.

1. Wash the rice and yellow lentil and soak them in water for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions until golden brown.
3. Add the ginger and garlic paste and sauté for another minute.
4. Add the soaked rice and lentil and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add water and bring to a boil.
6. Cover the pan and let it simmer on low heat for 20-25 minutes or until the rice and lentils are cooked.
7. In a separate pan, heat oil and fry the onions until golden brown.
8. Add the fried onions and ghee to the khichuri and mix well.
9. Serve hot with fried eggplant, salad, and chutney.

ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into small pieces
method_of_cooking:
1. In a bowl, mix together the chickpea flour, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt.
2. Add water to make a thick batter.
3. Add the chicken pieces to the batter and mix well.
4. Heat oil in a deep frying pan.
5. Drop the chicken pieces into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.
6. Drain the excess oil and serve hot with mint chutney.

1. In a pressure cooker, add the soaked split chickpeas and enough water to cover them.
2. Cook for 4-5 whistles or until the chickpeas are soft.
3. In a separate pan, sauté the onions, green chilies, and ginger paste until the onions are golden brown.
4. In a mixing bowl, add the ground beef, cooked chickpeas, and sautéed onion mixture.
5. Add salt, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and chopped cilantro to the mixture and mix well.
6. Shape the mixture into small patties or balls.
7. Heat oil in a pan and fry the patties until golden brown on both sides.
8. Serve hot with mint chutney and salad.

1. Heat oil in a pan and add the chopped onions. Fry until they turn golden brown.
2. Add the ginger and garlic paste and sauté for a few minutes.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft and mushy.
4. Add salt, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Mix well.
5. Add the shrimp to the pan and mix well with the spices.
6. Cover the pan and cook on medium heat for 10-12 minutes or until the shrimp are cooked through.
7. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan.

1. Wash the rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions until golden brown.
3. Add the ginger and garlic paste and sauté for another minute.
4. Add the Mutton and sauté until it is cooked.
5. Add water and let it simmer for 30 minutes until the Mutton is tender.
6. Drain the water from the soaked rice.
7. Add the rice to the Mutton and mix well.
8. Add water and cook until the rice is done.
9. Garnish with fried onions and chopped cilantro leaves.
10. Serve hot with raita and salad.

1. In a mixing bowl, add the flour, salt, and sugar. Mix well.
2. Add ghee to the mixture and rub with your fingers until the mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs.
3. Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a smooth dough.
4. Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.
5. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into thin discs.
6. Make small cuts on the discs with a sharp knife.
7. Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the discs until they are golden brown on both sides.
8. Serve hot with chana dal or curry.

1. In a mixing bowl, add the flour, salt, and sugar. Mix well.
2. Add ghee to the mixture and rub with your fingers until the mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs.
3. Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a smooth dough.
4. Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.
5. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into thin discs.
6. Make small cuts on the discs with a sharp knife.
7. Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the discs until they are golden brown on both sides.
8. Serve hot with chana dal or curry.

1. In a mixing bowl, add the semolina, all-purpose flour, salt, and baking powder. Mix well.
2. Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a smooth dough.
3. Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.
4. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into thin discs.
5. Cut out small circles from the discs with a cookie cutter or lid.
6. Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the circles until they are golden brown on both sides.
7. Take the fried circles out of the oil and poke a small hole in the center of each circle.
8. Stuff the circles with a mixture of mashed potatoes, chickpeas, chopped onions, cilantro, tamarind paste, and spices.
9. Serve hot with tamarind water.

1. In a mixing bowl, add the semolina, all-purpose flour, salt, and baking powder. Mix well.
2. Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a smooth dough.
3. Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.
4. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into thin discs.
5. Cut out small circles from the discs with a cookie cutter or lid.
6. Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the circles until they are golden brown on both sides.
7. Take the fried circles out of the oil and poke a small hole in the center of each circle.
8. Stuff the circles with a mixture of mashed potatoes, chickpeas, chopped onions, cilantro, tamarind paste, and spices.
9. Serve hot with tamarind water.

1. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent.
2. Add the ginger and garlic paste and cook for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add the chicken and cook until it is browned on all sides.
4. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, nutmeg powder, mace powder, cardamom powder, bay leaves, and cinnamon sticks. Mix well.
5. Add water and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
6. Add the yogurt and cream. Mix well.
7. Cook for another 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
8. Remove from heat and serve hot with rice or naan.

1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the yogurt and cold water until well combined.
2. Add the roasted cumin powder, black salt, and sugar. Mix well.
3. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
4. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
5. Serve cold with spicy snacks or biryani.

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt.
2. Add the vegetable oil and mix until the flour is crumbly.
3. Slowly add the warm water and knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic. The dough should be firm and not sticky.
4. Cover the dough and let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
5. Divide the dough into small balls, approximately the size of a golf ball.
6. Roll out each ball into a thin circle, approximately 4-5 inches in diameter.
7. Heat the oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.
8. Once the oil is hot, add the luchis one at a time and fry until golden brown, flipping once.
9. Remove from the oil and place on a paper towel-lined plate to remove excess oil.
10. Serve hot with your favorite side dish.

ingredients: 1 kg beef, cut into small pieces
method_of_cooking:
1. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the plain yogurt, ginger paste, and garlic paste.
2. Add the beef pieces and mix well, making sure the beef is coated with the marinade.
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
4. In a blender, grind the white poppy seeds and cashew nuts into a fine paste.
5. Heat the ghee in a large pot over medium-high heat.
6. Add the onion paste and sauté until lightly golden brown.
7. Add the marinated beef and stir well.
8. Cook for 10-12 minutes or until the beef is browned on all sides.
9. Add the ground poppy seed and cashew nut paste, salt, and sugar to taste.
10. Stir well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
11. Add water and bring to a boil.
12. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the beef is tender and the gravy has thickened.
13. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
14. Serve hot with steamed rice, naan, or paratha.
